events.description: The upcoming release of natural gas storage data by the Energy Information Administration.
Severe cold weather in the previous week that impacted gas inventories.
Geopolitical conflict that caused global supply disruptions in the energy market.

facts.fact_text: US natural gas futures were priced at $3.45 per million British thermal units on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: US natural gas futures were little changed at $3.45 per million British thermal units on Thursday

facts.fact_text: Gas flows to the eight largest US LNG export plants averaged 18.3 bcfd in February.

evidences.evidence_text: Gas flows to the eight largest US LNG export plants averaged 18.3 bcfd so far in February

facts.fact_text: The US became the world’s largest LNG exporter in 2023.

evidences.evidence_text: The US became the world’s largest LNG exporter in 2023

facts.fact_text: Natural gas production in the Lower 48 reached 106.4 bcfd.

evidences.evidence_text: Production in the Lower 48 edged up to 106.4 bcfd

claims.claim_text: Analysts expect heavy withdrawals to have shifted inventories from 5% above normal to 1% below normal.
claims.author: Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: Analysts expect heavy withdrawals during last week’s Arctic blast to have shifted inventories from about 5% above normal to roughly 1% below normal

claims.claim_text: Weather is expected to turn mostly warmer nationwide through February 19.

evidences.evidence_text: Weather is expected to turn mostly warmer nationwide through February 19

claims.claim_text: The Northeast will remain colder for another week.

evidences.evidence_text: though the Northeast will remain colder for another week

evidence.evidence_text: Analysts expect heavy withdrawals during last week’s Arctic blast to have shifted inventories
reflecting strong global demand for US gas
The US became the world’s largest LNG exporter in 2023 amid supply disruptions following Russia’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine
traders awaited the weekly EIA storage report and weighed strong LNG demand against milder weather forecasts
